summary: This document is a series of official inmate count sheets and rosters from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 10, 2019. It includes unit-by-unit inmate counts and a specific roster listing inmates on suicide watch or unassigned status. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of the prison population at the MCC, where Jeffrey Epstein was held, on a date shortly after his death.

persons.name: Bullock
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 86409-054, assigned to hospital (HOSP) and on suicide watch or unassigned status.

persons.name: Santana
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 48816-066, assigned to unit K09 and on suicide watch.

persons.name: Walker
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 86900-054, assigned to unit E06 and on suicide watch or unassigned status.

persons.name: Woolaston
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 85369-054, assigned to unit K11 and on suicide watch or assigned to FS Warehouse.

events.title: Daily Inmate Count at MCC New York
events.description: Routine official inmate count conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, documenting the population by housing unit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document records an official inmate count at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 10, 2019.
A specific inmate roster lists four inmates (Bullock, Santana, Walker, Woolaston) who were on suicide watch or had special assignments.
The total inmate count recorded across all housing units was 758, with an out-count of 754.
The document is a standard Bureau of Prisons administrative form used for tracking inmate location and status.
The date places this document in the immediate aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death at the same facility on August 10, 2019.
